intro: Tarenna zimbabwensis, commonly known as the Zimbabwean tarenna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Tarenna zimbabwensis is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses.
